description:
Construction of new gatehouse with associated barriers, alteration to vehicular access and installation of 8 pole mounted CCTV cameras (Reconsultation)
 
 PLEASE NOTE THAT THE ASSOCIATED PLANS ARE NOT VIEWABLE ONLINE DUE TO THE TIME THAT HAS LAPSED SINCE THIS APPLICATION WAS SUBMITTED
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the gate house shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment (2004)'. | Notwithstanding the stopping up of the highway within the application site, access shall be made available without obstruction at all times to pedestrians, cyclists and public transport.   Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 9.1, 9.2, 9.4, 9.5 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment (2004)'. | Details of the highway works including any alterations to the existing highway to be carried out by the developer shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning authority prior to commencement of works. Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained. No development shall be place until the highway works have been constructed in accordance with approved details.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council+s adopted Unitary Development Plan +Plan for the Environment+ (2004)
